name: Gong Yuan Ma La Tang 宫源麻辣汤 @ Clementi Mall

reviews.text: Tried the mala soup, but found that it didn’t quite capture the authentic mala flavor. Unfortunately, it didn’t feel worth the price. Seating is also quite limited, so do take note if you’re planning to dine in
Good soup broth fixed, I tried pickled veg soup and it was quite tasty. They also have a free flow kimchi station which is a plus! Can give it a try if you need an affordable place for soup cravings.

Price is around $15 per pax for a filling dinner! Dined in at this Clementi Mall outlet on a weekday dinner at 6pm, staff were swift in taking orders. I had tried the mala soup and added a “beaten egg” which made the soup super creamy. There’s a condiment bar with free flow kimchi, spring onion, coriander and sesame paste. Would be good if they could add on peanuts as a condiment as well. The food counter (meat and vegetable) area was kept clean with no foul smell that mala places sometimes have, and condiment counter was rather clean. You have to self service from taking your own food to returning your plates etc, but there’s no service charge so definitely reasonable! One point is that I wish the tables were better cleaned though. Because everyone returns their own dishes, the tables aren’t cleaned by staff as frequently. Would recommend getting the potato noodles as that paired really well with the broth. I’d skip on the instant noodles selection the next time. Meat and vegetables were all fresh!

I recently tried Gong Yuan Ma La Tang at Clementi Mall and found the overall experience quite decent. The ingredients were fresh with a good variety to choose from. However, I found the soup a bit too salty for my taste. The service was quick and efficient. It’s a self-service style where you pick your ingredients and pay by weight.

my friends and i came to have lunch (we ate here at this branch before, on a weekly basis) but on this particular week we took lesser ingredients but paid almost double the price of what we normally get. $28/$27 for 800g and $25 for 700g. not just that, the server at the cashier was rude and did not want to answer our questions at all. super dismissive attitude and not helpful at all. we have proof of how much we had spent in the last few weeks, all below $20. someone needs to get that cashier lady checked.
